problem_summary_simple: Count paths from top-left to bottom-right in a matrix where the sum of elements is divisible by k.
problem_summary_technical: DP state dp[i][j][rem] stores paths to (i,j) with sum % k = rem. Transitions from (i-1,j) and (i,j-1).
key_insights: The problem can be solved using dynamic programming where the state includes the current cell and the remainder of the path sum modulo k.
The transitions involve considering paths coming from the top and left cells, updating the remainder based on the current cell's value.
Modulo arithmetic is crucial to handle large numbers of paths.
